summary: Thailand's Personal Data Protection Act 2019 establishes comprehensive data protection rules based on GDPR principles, adapted for the Thai legal and cultural context. The law protects personal data of individuals in Thailand and regulates cross-border data transfers.

data_subject_rights.name: Right to Access
data_subject_rights.description: Data subjects can request access to their personal data and information about processing
data_subject_rights.thai_term: สิทธิในการเข้าถึงข้อมูล

data_subject_rights.name: Right to Rectification
data_subject_rights.description: Right to correct inaccurate or incomplete personal data
data_subject_rights.thai_term: สิทธิในการแก้ไขข้อมูล

data_subject_rights.name: Right to Erasure
data_subject_rights.description: Right to delete personal data under certain circumstances
data_subject_rights.thai_term: สิทธิในการลบข้อมูล

data_subject_rights.name: Right to Restrict Processing
data_subject_rights.description: Right to limit how personal data is processed
data_subject_rights.thai_term: สิทธิในการจำกัดการประมวลผล

data_subject_rights.name: Right to Data Portability
data_subject_rights.description: Right to receive personal data in a structured, machine-readable format
data_subject_rights.thai_term: สิทธิในการโอนย้ายข้อมูล

data_subject_rights.name: Right to Object
data_subject_rights.description: Right to object to processing for direct marketing and legitimate interests
data_subject_rights.thai_term: สิทธิในการคัดค้าน

data_subject_rights.name: Right to Withdraw Consent
data_subject_rights.description: Right to withdraw consent for processing at any time
data_subject_rights.thai_term: สิทธิในการถอนความยินยอม

special_requirements: PDPC notification required for certain transfers
Government approval needed for sensitive data transfers
